text: Newton's leaf-toed gecko (Hemidactylus newtoni ) is a species of lizard in the family Gekkonidae. ==Etymology== The specific name, newtoni, is in honor of Portuguese botanist Colonel Francesco Newton.Beolens, Bo; Watkins, Michael; Grayson, Michael (2011). The Eponym Dictionary of Reptiles. Baltimore: Johns Hopkins University Press. xiii + 296 pp. . (Hemidactylus newtoni, p. 189). ==Geographic range== H. newtoni is endemic to the island of Annobón in Equatorial Guinea. ==Reproduction== H. newtoni is oviparous. ==Taxonomy== H. newtoni was described and named by Júlio Bethencourt Ferreira in 1897. ==References== ==Further reading== *Ferreira, J. Bethencourt (1897). "Sobre um Hemidactylus novo da ilha de Anno Bom ". Jornal de Sciencias, Mathematicas, Physicas e Naturaes, Academia Real das Sciencias de Lisboa, Segunda Série 4: 249–251. (Hemidactylus newtoni, new species). (in Portuguese). newtoni Category:Endemic fauna of Annobón Category:Reptiles of Equatorial Guinea Category:Reptiles described in 1897
title: Newton's leaf-toed gecko
